transcript.sentence: Group of children skipping in the park. There are other children on swings and skipping rope. In the background. There are two skyscrapers.
Young girl with brown hair touching a puddle of water on the grass field with her finger.
She looks up at the sky and it starts pouring rain. She runs out of the park to avoid the ring. The other kids in the park run out of the park as well.
Two people clearing dinner table plates. In the background is a little girl watching cartoons changes channel to storm report.
Changes channel to report of car flooded.
She squeezes her polar bear stuffed animal.
Iceberg collapsing.
Dad carries little girl to bed. Mom kisses her forehead and turns off the light.
They leave the room.
She closes her eyes and goes to sleep.
She sits up and looks around some more.
Then she stands up and takes a few steps forward.
Yeah.
She wakes up in a well lit place and starts to look around her surroundings.
There are dust particles floating over her.
Her bed is outside in the middle of a flat,
dry desert with a rocky mountain in the background.
She stops to stare at an empty swing, set swinging.
The land starts to split apart from the swing set and follows the little girl.
She runs as fast as she can with the earth splitting behind her.
She stops to turn around because she's dropped her polar bear plush toy in the rift of the earth.
She tries to reach down in the rift to grab her polar bears. Paul.
The sky turns dark gray, and she turns around to look at a huge tornado forming in front of her.
But does not successfully get it.
She steps backwards on the cracks of the earth.
An ocean emerges and rises quickly and soon covers the entire land.
She jumps to cling on to a tree with both hands to avoid the ocean.
She goes from screaming from a tree to screaming from her bed, waking up in a cold sweat.
She is sitting on her windowsill explaining her nightmare to her dad.
C o p 15 is typed into the web browser.
Link goes to the main page of the united nations climate change conference for december 7 to december 18, 2009.
A sub link is clicked that re directs to YouTube. The title says, raise your voice, change climate change,
raise your voice and be a part of
cope 15. Submit your video. Now contribute to a meaningful discussion about our world's future.
Dad is showing the little girl these videos and looking at her.
She takes a video camera and leaves the room to run upstairs to the outdoor rooftop with a smile on her face.
She runs to a corner of the roof and points the video camera lens towards her face.
Other children's submissions are played.
Text displays cope 15 copenhagen.
We have the power to save the world
now.
With her polar bear in her hands.
With no shoes on.

result.title: Please help the world - COP15 opening film
result.description:
"Please Help the World", film from the opening ceremony of the United Nations Climate Change Conference 2009 (COP15) in Copenhagen from the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Denmark. Shown on December 7, 2009 at COP15.

Director: Mikkel Blaabjerg Poulsen, producers: Stefan Fjeldmark and Marie Peuliche, cinematographer: Dan Laustsen, production designer: Peter de Neergaard, editor: Morten Giese, composer: Davide Rossi, sound design: Carl Plesner, production company: Zentropa RamBuk, advisory consultants: Mogens Holbøll, Bysted A/S and Christian Søndergaard, Attention Film ApS.
